From the moment we walked in the door, the staff was incredibly friendly and eager to tell us about the delicious looking cupcakes in their display case. We were immediately seated and quickly brought the homemade Arnold Palmer which was quite tasty. 

Unable to resist the call of chorizo, I ordered the Chorizo Strata. The bread cubes were perfectly toasted and the spicy, yummy flavors of the pepperjack cheese and chorizo blended beautifully in each bite! My friend ordered the Daisy Burger and although I loved my strata, I have to admit that I couldn't help but steal bites of his burger throughout the entire meal. The chicken patty was so moist and flavorful that I just couldn't resist. I will likely order it myself when I visit again!

To end our wonderful meal, we shared one of the month's featured cupcakes, "The Blues." With a sweet potato cake, filled with BBQ/Bacon/Chocolate ganache and topped with a whiskey buttercream, this was definitely unlike anything I had ever tried before and it was amazing! It was very tasty, but having sampled many cupcakes before, I would say that the cake lacked a bit of moisture. Still delicious though.

Daisy Cafe is definitely a place worth visiting! Not only is the food delicious, but every member of the staff is extremely eager to share information about their menu and cupcakes!

The whole trend of cupcakeries seems really bourgeois.  It's about as awesome as buying a $4.50 cup of coffee.

Anyway, the cupcakes are NOT that special. They seem dry, and the buttercream has that taste of being made with shortening, rather than butter.  At $2.50 each, I'd honestly rather spend my money on a duncan hines mix and make 2 dozen at home.

Fun neighborhood place with delicious breakfasts and a large menu of options (including vegetarian plates).  Everyone I've brought here has liked it, too.  Down to earth staff seem sincerely happy to have you there.  

Admittedly, I am not a cupcake expert but I did enjoy the red velvet cupcake.  Daisy Cafe seems generous with the frosting on their cupcakes, if you like that.
Love this place!! Not only cupcakes...they have delicious dinners with a wide selection of Gluten free options. Very appealing menu with comfort food and fancy too.

This place is so unique . From the decor the layout of the place to the waitstaff . Great ambience .  Amazing food !! The cupcakes are a must try ! The red velvet and the chocolate explosion omg omg !! They are soooo soo good !!!  The mimosas are  quiet delightful  .

It's just ok. Really, I don't see what all the fuss is about this place. The cupcakes are average (definitely not something I would consider "cupcakery" worthy), as is the food and coffee. The atmosphere is not really anything special either. I don't go there on a consistent basis (because I'm not that impressed with it), but whenever I do go there,  the staff and service is always nice.

This has become a regular spot for my boyfriend and I to get breakfast or brunch on the weekends. My most common order is the breakfast sandwich which is just delicious. I also commonly get the huevos rancheros.  The place is usually hopping with couples of different ages and young families  - but somehow they avoid long wait times. The service is almost always excellent (attentive, speedy, cheerful) and the prices are reasonable.  The ambiance is sort of "bohemian sunflower farm"; with mismatched wooden tables and chairs but decidedly hippy-flare. I've definitely enjoyed becoming a regular here.

Daisy is one of our favorite spots in town.  We tend to think of them first for breakfast or brunch, but there are great lunch and dinner choices as well.  I'm a big fan of their chili-espresso steak hash, the burgers, and you have to try the meatloaf (several varieties to choose from)!

Daisy consistently wins the "friendliest waitstaff" award in local polls, as you'll see why when you come in.  It's an eclectic cafe with a casual atmostphere.  As the name implies, they have a bakery case full of all sorts of interesting cupcakes.  Today's variety included maple bacon (with actual strips of bacon!) and at least two that were made with local beers.

Disappointed. 1st time and probably last. I drove to the other side of town to pick up some cupcakes for a bday here. Was a little disappointed how small the cupcakes were for $2.75, nevertheless I grabbed 6 different ones to try. I expected more variety also.. It was just meh. 

Even if they weren't larger in size I expected it to make up in taste. Sadly the cupcakes were a bit dry and nothing memorable. If I had something nice to say the buttery icing was the only thing I liked. Hyvee however is comparable if not better.. Sorry 

Didn't eat the food there so comment.

Two friends and I just ate lunch at Daisy Cafe and Cupcakery on its fourth day in business (today is May 21, 2009), and we were very pleased.  The service was slow (hopefully just a first-week-open problem that they'll solve soon), but the staff was very friendly and the food was delicious.

I ordered the fresh vegetable strata, a souffle-ish dish of eggs, cheese, veggies, and bread cubes.  It was wonderful!  The eggs were light and fluffy, the bread cubes were a nice crusty contrast, and there was just the right amount of gruyere cheese baked into the dish to make it flavorful without being overwhelming.  It came with a side of seasoned roasted red potatoes and fresh fruit, all of which was excellent.  My friend, Michael, ordered the beef and bacon meat loaf, which came in its own adorable little dish and was perfectly cooked, moist and flavorful with lots of yummy little vegetable chunks mixed in with the ground meat.  My other friend, Haley, ordered the egg sandwich, which we all agreed was a serious egg sandwich, in the best sense.  No mere fried egg slapped on a roll with some cheese, this was, rather, a well-considered sandwich of crusty bread, egg, gruyere cheese, and red onions (which added an especially flavorful kick).

Full but not wanting to pass up the bakery section of Daisy, we each got a cupcake to go.  While the presentation was lovely, it seemed rather wasteful to put each individual cupcake in its own cardboard box (with an additional stabilizing cardboard device inside).  Once I ate the cupcake, however, I realized why such accoutrements were necessary: the frosting on the cake was so soft that it was even a bit melty, and the cake itself was rather spongey and soft.  I prefer a firmer cake with a thicker, stiffer frosting, so this did not particularly suit my fancy (I did, however, appreciate the taste of the frosting, which was whipped cream, as opposed to the more typical buttercream frosting--this was much less sweet, and the fruit flavoring was quite obviously real).

So go for the meal, skip the cupcake, and enjoy the open, sunny room, the good tunes on the stereo, and the friendly vibe while you wait (hopefully not too long) for your server to take your order!
I love Daisy Cafe! The atmosphere, food, people, decor.... Such great things. Small town delight in a hip part of Madison. Love! Highly recommend.

Breakfast!  It still exists!
I have spent years trudging through one breakfast place after another.  Often a mirage would appear upon the horizon of what promised to be an oasis of perfectly cooked eggs, sausage, potatoes and other morning food staples only to have the image fade with the sad plate set before me.  Though some restaurants did better than others none became a true go to place for true satisfaction.   
Then suddenly, without mirage -though with some high recommendations by others, I entered the Daisy Cafe and Cupcakery.  My experience went like this:
Cafe.  Here it is.
Place to park.  Good.
Greeted as I entered.  Good.
Cupcakes? Yep, there they are.
Seating?  A lot of tables and some terrific artwork dancing off the walls.
Menu. Bam! Pow! Kazzowie! This is GREAT!   Look at the great selection.  
Happily my dish and the dishes of those with me were all excellent.  Everything was served beautifully. We eat with our eyes you know.   The coffee was very good. (imagine!)  The service was spot on.  The potatoes were some of the best tasting and correctly done I have had in a long long time.
I now have a place go to for a good breakfast with entrees done in unique and creative ways.  Thanks for putting these dishes on a menu and having someone who can cook like this.
After breakfast I explored a little more.  The art in the back room is somewhat Edward Goreyesque.  Is this for Halloween?  Or does this art remain in the back room throughout the year?  I like it for the season but not year round.  
The washroom was a bit crowded/awkward.  It was clean and the mirror is terrific.  I just hate being squeezed up against a wall.  Can you improve this?  Yes.
Overall, I and those with me had a great breakfast and a good time.  If more people find out how good the food is here they will run out of room fast.

See? I did it...I stopped back to try their food. Boy, was I glad I did! My friend and I got brunch on a Sunday. There was a short wait when we arrived around 11 am. We browsed the cupcake selection while we waited. Their "cupcakes of the month" are very pretty.

We were seated and attended to by the best server. He was amazing! My friend got the huevos rancheros (her second time ordering them). I got the turkey meatloaf with pesto, feta and sun dried tomato. It was served with some sauteed vegetables and grilled potatoes with great seasoning. Everything was fresh and delicious.

After breakfast, we ordered a couple of cupcakes each to take home. I ended up trying the root beer, red velvet and one made with Tyranena beer (from my hometown)! The red velvet was the least expensive and the best. Great frosting, ok cupcake. The other two were $3.25 a piece. I probably wouldn't get another "cupcake of the month" again since I liked the $2.75 cupcake the best.

I wish they would drop the cupcake part of their name. If rating on cupcakes, they get a 3. If rating on food, they get a 5. So I had to average it out to a 4 since they do promote their cupcakes.

Grabbed breakfast here with my brother, after a night of gaming. Breakfast menu is somewhat limited but creative. I had a mushroom and cheese strata. It was super hot and pretty tasty. It also had sundries tomatoes and was supposed to have spinach, I believe, but I didn't see any. The potatoes that cam with it looked good but they lack flavor and weren't very warm. My brother had the Biscuits and Gravy. It wasn't traditional sausage gravy-more of a Latin version, but it was good, with just the rightf amount of kick. Service was okay. A little rough around the edges, but she was nice and tried her best. I'm sure we will be back as it is walking distance from my brother's house.

I keep coming here and I keep leaving super happy!
Breakfast review:
Had the "award winning egg sandwich"; for the 1st time. I can clearly see why it may be called this. Yum! 
A fried egg with cream cheese, onion & cilantro. Yup, it's goodness all on toasted rosemary bread. Hard to beat this for a breakfast sandwich.
The best  part of breakfast at Daisy is the red breakfast potatoes. I'm not sure what they are cooking in them but the really tasty. If I had to guess, It's almost like they are cooking them in some chorizo leftovers maybe...Great flavor & perfectly cooked.

Fresh fruit with most of the breakfasts! 

Also if you order a omelet,  you will be very happy with what you are given!!!!!! They are never stingy with fillings/veggies/and meats. You are going to leave here happy. Trust me!

Bottomless coffee. They keep your cup full the entire visit as well. Again, not sure what kind of coffee they are offering but it is great stuff! 

Daisy----I think you are great!

For cupcakes I definitely think they are as good as it gets! They are creative and always delicious. I've had lunch and dinner here. The menu is fabulous, the options are unique and fresh! The lemonade is home made and it is absolutely wonderful. The only bad thing I could say about this place is that they should get comfier chairs ;)
I love their multigrain pancakes with a side of breakfast potatoes. Mmmmm. Their cupcakes are really good, but the cake part tends to be a bit dry for my taste.

I went here for restaurant week and will definitely come back again! I also want to try their breakfast/brunch. It's a cute cafe and has pastries you can purchase from a counter at the front.

Service was outstanding. My waiter was genuinely friendly, which made the whole experience even more enjoyable.

For the three courses, I got a crab enchilada, tortelloni, and a chocolate cupcake. I was pleasantly surprised by the generous portions. I finished every bite (except the German cake filling in the chocolate cupcake - I'm not a fan of coconut). My roommate got steak, and her mashed potatoes were so good they were addictive. I kept stealing them off her plate!

While their lot was full, we didn't have any issues finding street parking right outside. We went on a Wednesday night and had a reservation, but probably didn't need one although the place was pretty full.
I've never had a meal I disliked here. The wait staff is always very nice and accommodating. An eclectic and friendly atmosphere, not to mention the cupcakes are to die for.

I've wanted to try out Daisy forever... but it's a bit of a drive for me and the reviews on yelp were a little weak so I never made it over.  After about the 7th person telling me how great it was I decided to try it out.  
LOVE.  
Service: host was very nice and helpful, so was the other girl at the counter.  Our server was nice, but fairly absent.  Not horrible 
Our food was great and the drinks were WONDERFUL.  Great bloody and mimosa with fresh OJ, coffee was good too.  We got cupcakes to-go and OMG!  I'm so mad at myself for waiting so long to try it!!!  Chocolate cake, maple cream with BACON is so very very very good.  Vanilla is great too.
Really nice place. One of the places we like to take out of state visitors. The vegetarian selection are very high quality. Delicious cupcakes.
I'm amending this because I've never found better huevos rancheros. They're the best and I crave them constantly. A+, guys.

We make a point to stop here whenever we visit my sister in Madison. I've probably eaten here more than 5 times and it's been great. I'm gluten-free and I've enjoyed numerous menu items on their breakfast, lunch, and dinner menu selections. I always eat a cupcake with my gluten-free son too. Delicious and never any ill-effects. We will be back! :)

This is some amazing home cooking!

A co-worker introduced me to this place and I've been hooked since.  REAL food, not the sodium laced food you get at the standard chain restaurants (though we patronize many of those as well).  I'm not a vegetarian but my rule is at a good restaurant I choose the vegetarian entrees because I know they will be delicious and this is no exception.  I'm hooked on the No-Meat Loaf and hubby get the Reuben Meat Loaf.  Both come with new potatoes at lunch time (mashed potatoes at dinner which is the one item I don't care for simply because of the butter) and sautéed vegetables.  If we're there at dinner I get the vegetable enchiladas.

The restaurant has a very casual feel with tables that don't necessarily match each other (who needs that anyway) and the waitstaff seems uniform free.  I'd love to know if this is a great place in Madison to work because it seems to have that vibe.

Given the "feel" of the restaurant one thing I'm surprised they don't have is at least a small bike rack.  We biked there for lunch once and had to chain our bikes to a railing which isn't ideal for us and likely got in the way of pedestrians.  All very minor, just something to point out if you plan to bike there.

I was delighted when my boyfriend surprised me with a couple cupcakes(to split) from the Daisy Cafe. He had gotten the Carrot Walnut, and the Vanilla Blueberry. The Carrot was good(what isn't good with a nice cream cheese frosting?), but I found the Vanilla Blueberry to be ordinary, if even a bit dry. I like a moist, but fluffy cake, which this just wasn't. Perhaps it was due to being in the pastry box he brought home for a couple hours...but I'm not sure.  Overall, I consider these treats good but basic.

4.5 Stars!

Very casual, warm and inviting atmosphere. Daisy is one of those relaxed joints we've been eyeing for a while so glad we got a chance this past weekend. A bit late for lunch but nonetheless we drove over around late afternoon.

Service : Sweet, friendly and attentive. Impressive considering we came at an odd "in-between" lunch and dinner time frame. No complaints!

Food : We ordered Reuben Meatloaf and Roasted Vegetable Enchiladas (With house?made chorizo). We took some Sweet Things (Duh!) but Ill get to that later.

The Reuben Meatloaf was delicious! I don't know how but somehow they made the texture of it very similar to a well made crab cake! The combination of meats and spices in the loaf was perfect. The meatloaf itself was moist and you could taste the individual components of cheese and even sauerkraut! I love their version of 1000 Island sauce with chopped boiled eggs.

The Enchiladas dish was better than what I've had at a lot of traditional Mexican restaurants! Their chorizo was seasoned well and finely chopped so you get these scrumptious little nibbles throughout as you devour your dish. The black bean paste was sensational and can stand on its own as a dish in itself! The whole dish was portioned rather generously and the balance of flavors was to the point. Well done!

Now onto the Sweet Things I mentioned. We boxed a  Peanut Butter cheesecake and a Standard Chocolate Cupcake as they ran out of all the Gooey/Filing ones :(.... Nonetheless, the frosting was rich and creamy and easily the best part of the cupcake. The cake itself was a tad dense and dry. Not too bad though. The cheesecake was baked very well and you'll love it if you like me love peanut butter!


All in all, if you haven't had a chance to drop by this joint, please do so!

Really liked it.  Much better feel than Bunky's that was there before. (Bunky's is still a great restaurant). More space, couch, great back room for meeting, parties, etc.  The cupcakes were good, I did expect a little more va, va, vavoom with the icing, but they were good.  Bottomless cup of coffee.

Cupcakes are all right but I can't say the food is anything to go out of the way for.  Service is a bit meh.

I ordered a chorizo omelet.  Omelet came without the avocado that was supposed to be on top. The meal also came with a generous portion of melon, but unfortunately, because it was on the same plate, the fruit ended up having taco sauce on it.  They told me they were out of rolls and said I could substitute for toast.  Then I had to ask them to bring out toast when they forgot.  Also, I had to go up to the counter myself to ask for water refill.

My companion's food was better--seems like I'd stick to t he lighter fare here--he got a hummus sandwich w/ edamame salad.

I am so happy to be in walking distance of such a perfect breakfast restaurant. The best egg sandwich I've ever had, amazing home fries, tons of vegetarian options, and of course, delicious cupcakes! They have an expansive menu, which at some places can mean the quality of dishes suffers, but Daisy puts 100% into every menu item. I have never been disappointed with anything I've ordered. They've really hit the nail on the head by using quality ingredients to make even simple dishes (like the Wisconsin Burger, which at first glance looks very plain) taste amazing.

Great service too! Things can get slow during their busiest times, but once when my drink order was lost and I had to remind the server of it, he apologized profusely and took it off our tab, which I really appreciated. (Thanks, Michael!)

What a great brunch experience!! We arrived at peak brunching time and were nervous there would be a wait-- however, they have so many tables that our wait was less than 10 minutes! From then on, it was nothing but smooth sailing.

Our server was a total rock star-- we sat in their back room and he was all hustle, efficiency and friendliness. Nothing took too long, which is unusual for a brunch service, and our food was just perfect at a great price. The side of potatoes is probably my favorite in Madison now! 

We will definitely return and next time, I'll save room for a cupcake.
Waitress was pleasant. Food was good. Small mix up with order but fixed as beat they could.

Great for breakfast and dinner!

http://morethanjustdessert.wordpress.com/2012/05/20/daisy-cafe-cupcakery-restaurant-review/

I like taking out of towners to Daisy's. It has a really cool vibe that you don't get from too many other places. Wait staff here can be a little surly from time to time.. But usually they are just indifferent (which isn't much better). Also for whatever reason, it is ALWAYS so hot in this place. I must have never visited in the winter months, because I'm sure it's cooler.. But when I go here, I always start sweating!
As for food.. Yum!!!!  I love the award winning egg sandwich! And not that I ever would, but I like the option that you can substitute the bacon for avocado. This place is not only vegetarian friendly, but they have MANY vegetarian dishes that are actually tasty (many places cater to vegetarians only by omitting meat, but not by adding anything tasty and substantial to their dishes). Also, the potatoes that come on the side of many dishes are absolutely delicious. 
I love that I can eat here if I want to eat healthy and leave feeling full and satisfied, but I can also choose to pig out if I want and be equally satisfied.

I have eaten here several times since my first review and I still LOVE everything about this place!!! The food, the service, the atmosphere, the EVERYTHING!!!  Tonight we went for restaurant week and the Brandy crab bisque was to die for (I actually got some to take home to have for lunch tomorow), the steak was made to perfection and the veggies were perfect!!!  I had the cheesecake which was also amazing!!!

A solid lunch joint. Also, it has a parking lot, which is a huge bonus for Atwood ave.

I loved their strata and their meatless loaf. Their menu is pretty extensive, so there is something there for everyone.

Also, breakfast is served until 3pm. Love me some pancakes for lunch!
Love this place! The breakfast is amazing. The spicy potatoes and pancakes are to die for!!

After living in the neighborhood for some time, my better half and I ventured to Daisy's for their happy hour. The drinks were delicious, but you never know when your number is called so we ordered the flourless chocolate cake. It arrived quickly and glistened like lake Monona on a night hosting a full moon. It took effort diving our forks into the creation, but once that morsel hit my lips every ounce of dopamine was released to my brain. All worries vanished leaving me in a tranquil yet positive state of mind. This establishment represents what it means to feel alive. I can't wait to try their food menu.

So much variety.   Gluten free vegitaerian, meal, dairy free.  Tried most everything but the meat and am impressed on how flavorful it all is.  The cupcakes are amazing and I no longer pay attention to anything but flavor as gluten free and dairy free makes no difference

We've been there twice...once on the drive from Cleveland to Minneapolis and once on the way back. I'm not sure if I can be completely objective because, after enough hours of driving, it seemed like an amazing oasis. That being said, the cupcakes were fantastic, the coffee was good, the ambiance was great, the service was friendly. We'll definitely consider stopping by the next time we're driving through the area.

My boyfriend and I finally tried this place for Saturday brunch after I moved just up the street almost 3 months ago. We were very impressed!! We are major suckers for the nearby Monty's Blue Plate diner, but the long wait times there can get annoying when all we really want is a high quality, delicious breakfast anyways. I am SO glad we came to Daisy Cafe. The restaurant was about 80% full so we were seated immediately at about 11:30 on a Saturday, when it can be tough to get a table in Madison.

Their version of huevos rancheros was pretty unique, as it was served with seasonal roasated veggies and a creamy yet spicy avocado tomatillo salsa. My boyfriend got one of their omelets - something with bacon and cheese. He said it could've used a veggie or two, but I'm sure they could've added something if he had asked. The side potatoes were absolutely wonderful as well; had more than a bit of a kick to them. 
I don't think we will ever go for lunch or dinner, I'm not much a meatloaf person and none of the other options on the menu really stood out to me, but as a breakfast place it was perfect.

Service was very friendly. I even noticed a woman next to us was asking for plain tomato juice, and the server searched all over the kitchen until he could find exactly what she wanted. We actually forgot to leave our tip on the table and didn't remember until we left the restaurant - they were totally nice about my mistake when I ran back in with a bunch of bills for the server. 

Cupcakes were just alright, I tried a strawberry champagne one but as a chocolate lover I know I'll have to give them another chance at some point. We will be back!

Must ask for wifi password.

5 stars for the Lemonade. Homemade lemonade done right and really well. I mean this is the stuff, right here. 


One can buy the Lemonada "good stuff" per glass or bottomless for $2.49.


I walked in and noticed a flyer for help wanted and I'm seriously thinking of applying as I do need the tip money. I have done too much travelling and plus, I like this place. I mean I like it for what it's worth and trying to do. Or so I perceive. 

Here's the dealy-o...
Good: The Lemonade, of course. 
The grilled cheese. It was not as thick as I had at The Noble a la Milwaukee nor Salt Grass Steakhouse but it worked. The 3 cheeses meshed well together. I was impressed with the collaboration. 

The ladies had an omelet type sandwich - one with bacon, one with avocado. They made accommodations for one with no cilantro with just a bit of cilantro hiding out. The no cilantro lady said the plate offering was more than she expected and couldn't finish it. 

Both ladies lady shared their oven potatoes. A few were under cooked. 
Paying at the register - they prefer cash and there's an ATM. 
Large leather brown sofas await your heiny if you have to wait for a table or just want to have a family talk away from the table so more people can eat. 

Plus, I don't see how the service won best service. I didn't read the huge banner saying such but I read Corey D's review stating such and was like there's no way. It wasn't busy and we were all first timers so the ladies took forever looking over the menu while I reviewed, in advance, to know what I want. I've had better service. I've given better service. Yet, something I've noticed as of late is I've had to ask for refills at several places in town. I don't know what that's about but it's water - please top off any and every glass.

Cupcakes seem to be on the tail end of "big things" lately.  While I still think of it as a bit of a fad, I hope that it outlasts frozen yogurt, but only if it means that places like Daisy still around.

The staff here is great.  They're exceptionally friendly and proud of their space, and they've never seemed frantic or annoyed when faced with a pile of people at the counter waiting for those random folks who take five minutes to pick out a few cupcakes to go.  That says a lot when you look at the overall size of the place.

The cupcakes themselves have always been spot on for me.  They make a soft icing, rather than the solid block of sugar on top through which you must cut.  The cake itself is always moist, and they run through a bunch of great themes, such as the Oktoberfest line they've got in place now.  I just picked out six and I have to give all kinds of props to the oatmeal stout and the pumpkin that I ate.  I missed out on the other four because I was too polite and shared.

I don't get here as often as I would like since I come in from Milwaukee, but I make it a point to come by every time I'm in the general neighborhood.  This is one of those shops that I've found Milwaukee has yet to match.

Only been here for Saturday morning breakfast so far (as this was one of our 'City Tin' locations). So glad we stopped in! 

I feel weird taking pictures in the context, but trust me when I say the place has a very warm and inviting decor - colorful lights and paintings, lots of natural light from the windows.

I had the Salmon/Cream Cheese/Pesto omelet served with very tender red potatoes, and I basically licked the plate clean. It arrived with generous slabs of pineapple and cantaloupe. My partner was thrilled that they serve Morningstar vegetarian products, and thoroughly enjoyed her Breakfast Sandwich. Though skeptical, I wanted to try a breakfast cocktail, and was extremely happy with the Whoopsy Daisy - a concoction of agave wine, lemon juice, and pomegranate molasses, garnished with lime. I normally don't enjoy something that sweet, but this was delicious.

The entire staff worked together to make sure we were never without water, coffee, hot sauce, etc. Overall, a great meal. We will be back!

We set out for breakfast on New Year's Day, tired and hungry and hung over. Not a damn thing was open (except Monty's, and there was a line out the door. Thanks but no thanks - we were at the hunger equivalent of DEFCON 1). After driving around for what seemed like forever, we finally stumbled upon Daisy Cafe, and it was open, and there was no wait. Hooray!

I've been here a few times now. The food is consistently great, and the cupcakes are really good too. The service is a little slow, but otherwise it gets a thumbs up.

This place is awesome. Some friends and I went there for brunch last weekend- enjoyed by meat eaters, vegetarians, savory and sweet lovers alike. Try the egg breakfast sandwich on rosemary bread or the No Meat loaf with crimini mushrooms and nuts. Deeeeelish.

A trip to Madison is just not complete without a stop at Daisy Cafe! Prior to coming here, I once believed that all Huevos Rancheros were created equally; I was quickly proven wrong as their bean-egg-cheese-salsa-whatever melody touched my tongue. Huevos Rancheros de la Daisy is my favorite rendition of my favorite breakfast food. 
As the latter part of their name suggests, their cupcakes are also fantastic! The available flavors change daily/monthly/seasonally, but if available, I recommend the Strawberry Champagne or Cinnamon Carrot flavors!

They had taken the turkey/feta meatloaf off the menu for a while but now it's back! Easily the best meatloaf they make. Another one of my favorites off their lunch/dinner menu is the chicken & chevre sandwich.

Went here for breakfast and was very impressed! The egg breakfast sandwich is incredible, fresh eggs, cilantro, cream cheese and onions; delicious!!! Not to mention fresh squeezed orange juice!

The cupcakes where good, nothing special. The frosting is very buttery which sometimes overpowers the flavor of what it's supposed to be (blueberry, vanilla, chocolate, etc). But if you're looking for a treat for yourself, they wont disappoint.

The only downside to eating here was there was a bit of a long wait for the food from when we ordered until we received it.

What?! They serve dinner too!  Being a "cupcakery", I've stopped in several times for their awesomely delicious cupcakes, but after stopping in for a full breakfast, was amazed, excited and delighted to discover they also have a full lunch and dinner menu too.  The building actually extends far back into the building, so it appears they have ample room for a dinner crowd.  Although, they did tell me that they take reservations on busy Saturday nights.  While we love going to Bunkys Cafe a couple locks away, I'm pleased to know there is another sit down dinner option same Atwood Street area that is a bit more moderately priced in comparison.

Enjoyed a Saturday lunch. Everything had great flavor and came fairly quick for being busy. The staff were very friendly as well. Had a TBA  (turkey bacon and avocado) sandwich on gluten free sandwich bread with a side of edamame salad. Took a gluten free blueberry lemon cupacke to-go, which was a nice treat when I got home. Will definitely be going back.

Mediocre service. The waitress looked my daughter and I as if we did not belong. We only had coffee and cupcakes .The coffee was ok, but for a place that calls themselves a ''cupcakery'' you would think they offered at least decent cupcakes. the moisture of the cupcakes is ok, but they merely tasted like sugar without real savory taste. I observed how waiters assisted the customers and I was just not impressed with the level of service. Most waiters did not hide the fact that they did not want to be at work on a sunday morning.

Have only gone for breakfast, but they seem to have a great balance of 'classic' and creative breakfast options.

Friendly & genuine staff. 

Love their goat cheese & roasted veggie omelette.

Don't forget to grab a cupcake! Moist and delicious.

Finally got brunch at Daisy Cafe, and it was great. The first good sign was that their menu looks awesome, and there were multiple things that appealed to both my husband and me.

I had the Chorizo & Avocado Omelette, and I loved it! The house-made chorizo was tasty without being too greasy or overwhelming. The egg was fluffy. The avocado was a great balancer, and there was enough to have some with every bite of omelette. The breakfast potatoes were also really good, as was the fresh fruit.

My husband's Chili-Espresso Steak Hash was good, if not as spiced as we hoped. The real star for me was the super-tasty tomatillo avocado salsa. I saw this with other things on the menu, and it was good enough to sway future choices.

We also brought a few cupcakes and a butter cake home. The butter cake was excellent, as was a carrot cake cupcake with cinnamon cream cheese frosting. I wasn't crazy about the buttercream-frosted cupcakes. The frosting was very buttery, not very sweet or strongly flavored. Fine, but not my jam.

I liked the eclectic, east side atmosphere, and the waitstaff was friendly and kept my water and coffee full. I went in really hungry and ate my whole meal, but I could  easily see having leftovers from their generous but reasonably-priced portions.

We'll definitely go back. The Chicken, Chutney, Chèvre sandwich is calling me already.

This place is awesome!!!!!!

Service 5stars
Food.    5stars

I had some of the most delicious biscuits and gravey iev ever had! They were a weekend special. Poblano chile gravey over delicious biscuits. I ordered a side of potatoes because they looked so delicious, and they were!

Our waitress was Megan, she was very attentive to our big group and was very helpful with all our questions :) we were visiting from California and had a lot of questions. She totally went above and beyond with her service :) thank you!

Good local place that will surprise you with their options. Menu is large and they are friend to special diets and vegetarians/vegans. They are known for their cupcakes but I have to say they are expensive and are the size of half of a average lady's palm. I tried the vegan cupcake even though I am not vegan. Shockingly, it was pretty darn good and taste like " the real deal".  

My issue is the atmosphere. Place is very small and I feel like I am sitting on top of other people. Nothing is uniformed which isn't an issue but they need new tables and chairs. I just felt very uncomfortable while dining there the 2 times I've gone.


Good would get a 4 stars but atmosphere hurts opinion a bit. 3.5 stars.

10/17/17 Ate here again. Last couple times my friend and I have been having brunch. Love their 'Daisy Sunrise-Sunset' drink. For $8, their 'Pick three' breakfast is the best, except that there are so many choices! Morningstar sausage is a nice option, but their oatmeal pancake will fill you up for hours. Service was always fabulous and appreciate the advice on limited fruit options. Will most certainly be back.

Didn't try the cupcakes, as I was told they were okay but kinda dry.  We did have a couple of other baked goods at our table: the fruit coffee cake muffin was good but, yes, a bit dry.  The cinnamon roll was really good.  There was a good assortment of cupcakes in the case, and a couple that appealed to me, but I wasn't in the mood for a lot of sweets (and the mound of frosting on top of each kinda put me off...)

The meal, on the other hand, was great.  Service was good; we had a big group, constantly growing, and they did a pretty good job of handling it. (We had called ahead to warn them.)  I had the huevos rancheros, recommended by friends and every bit as good as they said.  Tasty, good ingredients, accompanied by fresh fruit... Mm.  I also had a "bottomless" house-made lemonade, which was nice.  

I'd certainly go back, and might someday try a cupcake.
Great atmosphere. Kickin' breakfast potatoes. Great burgers. Favorite place for brunch.

The food here is fairly and usually good, but the service was poor during our last visit. I have an aversion to being surprised by hot spice in my food so I asked the server about some of the choices. After our discussion about not liking hotly spiced food I decided on the crab cakes asking for something else to replace the sriracha sauce that came with the cakes. The menu didn't say the crab cakes were spicy, just listed the sauce as spicy. We had a discussion about some alternate sauce possibilities and I felt satisfied that my needs were being met. Until the crab cakes came, and were themselves spicy hot. The tarter sauce replacement helped tone them down but I took them home for my partner to eat. When I asked my server if she had known the crab cakes were spicy when I ordered them after our "spicy" discussion she replied that to her they weren't that spicy and it was a personal taste thing. She did apologize and said she should have told me. yeeeaah. Glad I am not allergic to hot peppers.

Eclectic restaurant. 

Came here for lunch and was delighted by the range of dishes, the hanging stained glass art, and the variety of bevies. 

My table ordered cobb salads, chicken sandwiches and one of their premium cupcakes. 

They have a rotating menu of cupcakes, so I went wild with their "Rock & Roll" concoction. It had buttercream and toffee and I don't know what all, but it was as rich as can be and that little nugget was all I needed to cap off a delightful meal.

Went here a couple of days ago for breakfast. Fairly large menu. Good gluten free options for my wife. This place has some pretty cool menu items that you won't find anywhere else. Wait staff was VERY prompt and friendly. 

Atmosphere is a tad too hodgepodge for my liking but.. Whatever. The food made up for it. 

Make sure to grab a few cupcakes to go!

It was good. It wasn't outrageously great, but it wasn't horrendously bad. 

I ordered the Turkey & Rosemary Omelet and my boyfriend ordered the French Toast Strata. 

My meal came with an omelet, oven-roasted potatoes and fresh fruit. While everything was good, I have to say that I probably could have made the meal at home. If I go back, I wouldn't not eat this again, but I would definitely like to try something from their lunch selection first. My boyfriend was pretty much in agreement there. While he said his meal was good, he wants to try their burgers. 

They have a nice size menu filled with lots of veggie and lean meat dishes, which are perfect for me. However, they also cater to my boyfriend's style with such dishes like the Wisconsin Pride Burger (cheese curds and bacon on top of a 1/2 lb burger). 

We actually went their for breakfast for my boyfriends birthday. With that in mind, we left with a cupcake (I passed; too full to even think about cupcakes). My boyfriend chose the carrot cupcake with cream cheese frosting and walnut bits sprinkled on top. He wolfed it down and said it was good. 

I may update this review after we go for lunch sometime.

I found myself on Atwood Ave and saw the Daisy Cafe. I had heard about it, but never had been there. I decided to get my kids each a cupcake. Totally disappointing. The frosting literally tastes like and has the texture of a lump of lard and the cupcakes themselves were dry. They looked really pretty and the young woman that helped me was very nice but even my husband, who eats anything said, "These are bad!"

Came here for weekend brunch and had no problem getting a table even though it was busy. The Bloody Mary was perfectly spicy and my mushroom soufflé was very savory. The breakfast potatoes were fresh and a big hit at our table. Brandon was our server and he was so sweet and attentive. Would love to come back next time we're in town!

I can't find anything to complain about.  Went there at 9am today for brunch and had the salmon omelet.  It was very flavorful and just the right size. I got a walnut, carrot cake cupcake to go and it was really moist and fresh tasting. I'd definitely love to try more of their flavors.

Tofu scrambles gets me going day and night. 
Usually i go to Monty's for the bk for din option, but tried Daisy's version for Sunday brunch this morning. 

Verdict - yummy (and gluten free, yes!). I don't know if they do breakfast all day, but if they do, I'll add this to my repertoire. If they don't, they should - please do. 
We didn't get "Madison's favorite waitstaff" service though. Negative one star for that. But I'll give it another try at Daisy's for sure.

My brother and I have been coming to this restaurant for years whenever I visit Madison. It has a special feel. The classic tables make you feel like you're at home your mom's kitchen.  The staff is ultra friendly and don't get me started on the food. Everything on this menu is amazing. I'm especially fond of their meatloaf.  About a year ago I started to take my food a little more seriously, and discover that this restaurant also has a wide variety of healthy options. Their salads are ridiculous. Their salmon is one of the best I've had.  They have a wide variety of beverages, including freshly squeezed orange juice. This place is definitely worth your time to visit. Oh, and to top it all off the prices are completely reasonable.

I really enjoyed the food, layout and staff.  I had the grilled cheese sandwich with avocado - and for this picky pregnant lady - it was a hit!  Our waitress was so nice, as was the owner when asked many questions about a potential private event.  They are flexible with group events, btw.  
I particularly liked the layout - the mismatched antique tables and chairs and lighting made for a pleasant experience.

I've been there 3 times and each meal has been rock solid. 

The award winning egg sandwich was that good amount of savory, crunchy breakfast whoa you want when you want a unique breakfast sandwich you can't replicate at home.

The pesto & vegetable pasta was the least favorite meal I've had here... but I should state, pasta isn't my favorite, so part of that was me. The flavors were there but it's hard to wow me with pasta. And it was a creamer dish than I anticipated. I expected a raw pesto base, not a creamy one.

Finally - the Daisy Cod Sandwich. WHOA!! All sorts of amazing things happening with that combination of panko breaded cod, slaw and sauce. HIGHLY recommend. (Although, if you're not a fan of spicy sauce, have the sauce on the side.)

Sadly, the cupcakes aren't my favorite in town. They aren't loaded with sugar, which is a plus. But I find them a little dry and haven't found a flavor that wows me. 

Oh- and the soup! Super good - made in house. (Very important to me.) Worth a try if your'e in a soup mood.

Meredith L nailed the review of the cupcake. The cake part was okay, however, the one I bought was very stale. The big disappointment was the frosting. As Meredith L said it should be a ..."rich creamy frosting.  This was really oily, and the frosting was really heavy on the shortening and light on the chocolate-flavored goodness." In my case it was vanilla, but still very light on vanilla flavor.

This is not a good cupcake.

Came for the cupcakes but ended up eating. The breakfast potatoes are superb. I had the tuna steak sandwich. Fabulous. Everyone in the group enjoyed their food. It was a little slow getting the did burr worth the wait. Atmosphere was enjoyable. One guy was working on the laptop while others socialized. Fun place!

i want to like these guys so badly, they always have really creative cupcakes designs and flavors so i keep giving them a shot when i am in town but EVERY TIME THE FROSTING IS TERRIBLE!!!  frosting-shaped creamed butter is not buttercream frosting.  other food options are just okay.

My roommates and I love Daisy! This restaurant is on a trendy, nice street and has a great ambiance. Their food is excellent (Egg Salad Sandwich is amazing) and, let's not forget, their cupcakes! Delish! It's a sweet little place and offers wi-fi, the staff is kind, and they do serve beer and wine.
Cupcakes are delicious! It's so hard to pick just one!

Sweet place.  Came here for the first time a few days ago and had a great lunch.  The caprese egg salad sandwich was fresh and full of flavor.  The coffee was good and the service was prompt.  Chill vibe- I will be back!

This update has been a long time coming! Rullll long. 

After SEVERAL more visits to DCC I can safely say this place rawks my socks off. I've grown to love their meatloaf, many of them, the bacon wrapped being my fave. But there's like 8 bajillion varieties so it's hard to pick a favorite. Their lunch sammies are uber tasty and the sides are delicious, the edamame a standout in my book. On a recent trip and during a weird week when I went super Paleo they made some mad accommodations for me which I appreciated. 

As rad as the menu is, as funky/cool as the interior is, as rawkin' as the jams are, nothing beats the people. Voted Madison's favorite servers three years in a row (the place has only been open for 3) there's just a good "we'll take care of you" sort of vibe about the place I've grown to love. I get the feeling that owners and staff are really in business to make people happy, push the envelope of what "healthy eating" means (it can taste good) and have a vested interest in the community and its history.

This is a very cute family run place with lots of local art on-site. I met friends for brunch and was impressed with the menu offerings - strata, egg sandwiches, pancakes and lunch options all looked tasty. They were out of the strata I wanted so I went with the turkey feta meatloaf. It was Ok. It was burned and a bit dry but covered in rosemary gravy. My sides were not good - veggie sticks drowning in oil and over salted roasted potatoes covered in oil. I would return to try the bakery items but am not rushing in for another meal.
Always good food and friendly staff. My favorite is the huevos rancheros. Gluten free entrees and cupcakes too.

Dry, bland, crappy cupcakes. Greasy frosting. What do they use, Crisco? Yuck. I can make my own damn cupcakes, thank you very much. Fucking bourgeois fad bullshit, that's what this is. Feh.

EDIT: While the cupcakes are trendy crap, the breakfast/brunch is actually not bad.

This is a cute little café with lots of tasty looking homemade cupcakes and pastries. We were here for a late lunch and had a nice fresh cob salad with chicken. It's worth stopping by when in the area.

I settled on three stars for this review, but I'd actually break it down like this: 4 stars if you're going just for the cupcakes and 2 stars for the rest of the menu.

On my first visit to Daisy Cafe, I'll admit I was disappointed at the selection in the cupcake display.  I had figured that a cupcake place would have cupcakes that were... well... a little more out of the ordinary.  As it turned out, the cupcakes may be simple but they are delicious.  The cake is light and fluffy and the frosting is similarly light and nicely flavored.  They have a vegan cupcake each day, which is what I tried on this first visit.  I'm not a vegan, and I'm usually wary of foods labeled vegan but this was delicious (and not just in a "good for a vegan cupcake" kind of way).

On my next visit I decided to give the breakfast menu a try.  I ordered a strata, which arrived a disappointing rubbery texture.  After this I came back a few times for the cupcakes, but avoided the food menu for fear of a repeat of the strata incident.

Now that they've been serving dinner for a while (Thurs-Sat) I decided to give them another try.  They have burgers on their menu, and it's hard to find a good burger, so I stopped in tonight to see how they rated.  I'll admit up front, I'm picky about my burgers.  If they aren't rare, they're not worth eating.  I had asked on a previous cupcake excursion if they cooked their burgers rare and had been assured they did.  Before I ordered, however, I verified this with my waitress who confirmed they would.

I ordered the basic burger with swiss cheese "very rare" and selected the edamame salad as my side.  After taking my order, the waitress returned with the most delicious whole wheat bread and whipped butter.  This bread was seriously good - I would buy it and take it home with me if I could.  I was a bit disappointed that the butter was served in disposable plastic condiment cups, which seemed like a waste.  I noticed that diners who had salads were served their dressing in small metal cups, which would have worked great for the butter as well.

As you've probably guessed, when my burger arrived it was not rare.  It could charitably be called medium rare but that would be stretching it.  If you like your burgers cooked, you'd probably like this one, but I don't.  On the plus side, the bun was good - toasty but not hard, and the tomatoes that came on the side were ripe, juicy, and firm enough to hold up on the burger.  It also came with a nice selection of greens.  I'm not sure if they were intended just to go on the burger, but if they were there were an awful lot of them.  They could have made a nice mini-salad, aside from the lack of dressing.

The edamame salad was a bit disappointing.  I should have asked what was in it before ordering, as I don't like onions and this had more onions than edamame.  I later heard a waiter describe this salad to another diner, but his description didn't really match up to the salad either.  It was tossed in a ginger dressing, which was actually good.  Unfortunately, the celery overpowered just about every other flavor in the salad, so you didn't really taste the dressing.

My waitress was apologetic(the staff has always been very friendly and attentive) when she stopped to check on my meal and I told her the burger wasn't cooked properly and offered me a free cupcake for the mistake.  The cupcake was, as usual, delicious.

Items Selected:
Bottomless Coffee
French Toast Strata (eggs, cream cheese, bread cubes, maple syrup) with oven roasted potatoes and fruit
Morning Bun

Carrot-Walnut Cake with Cinnamon Cream Cheese Frosting

Following up 4&20 with a few more pastries for the road the last stop on a recent trip to Madison was Daisy Café and Cuppcakery, a kitschy spot on Atwood Avenue where neither cuisine nor customer service experienced in-store was particularly remarkable, though 'back-to-school' themed cupcakes would later save the day.  Undoubtedly a spot for locals with the former part of the phrase 'shabby-chic' best describing the décor it was to a luke-warm greeting from the restaurant's lone server that I was greeted on entry and invited to seat myself that was precisely what I did, a minimal amount of effort expelled in re-filling both tepid coffee and water making me wish these things, too, were do-it-yourself.  Eventually allowed to order, a pair of two-tops already well into their meals apparently too much for one to handle, it would not be long before my pastry arrived and proving far less impressive than the standard set by 4&20 most of the morning bun was discarded, a similar situation occurring in the strata - a mundane bellybomb of flavorless bread soaked in eggs with only the slightest bit of sweetness to be found.  Utterly disappointed in the experience thus far it was only the presence of a man I presume to be the owner at the register and his interest in my Interpol T-shirt that prevented me from walking away with empty hands but after our short conversation I couldn't help but invest in a few cupcakes, the carrot cake a bit heavy handed but all three of the filled $3.00 specials showing great flavors and innovation amidst cakes of a delicate crumb.

We live nearby and this place is delish for lunch. The atmosphere is friendly and fun.Their chicken burger is awesome! We stop in just for a bag of coffee beans or pancake mix sometimes too. I will say as others have said their cupcakes are a little dry... that is why there is a big pile of frosting on top - that makes up for it a little I guess.

Had brunch at Daisy Cafe & Cupcakery this morning. We went thinking we were in the mood for lunch but both my boyfriend and I ended up eating breakfast. I opted for the french toast strata. It was quite good! I really enjoyed the flavor of the dish. The side of potatoes was also really good as well but didn't go with the main so I moved those to my boyfriend's plate. Overall, we enjoyed our meal. 

I did remove one star because of how loud it was in the restaurant. The layout makes it impossible to not hear everything that's going on. Both my boyfriend and I enjoy a little more of a relaxing atmosphere. Don't let that stop you from going to enjoy a nice meal.

Just met a good friend here for breakfast. And it was great! We both had the egg sandwich..... Amazing. I had a Bloody Mary, which I wasn't too thrilled with. But everything else was awesome with the service and food.

We came all the way from Austin, TX to visit family. It was about noon but we were craving breakfast food. This place is so awesome! Great big portions, super friendly service and a cozy environment. Breakfast is served till 3!

Never knew Cupcakeries existed before coming here. Great name, great food in addition to the cupcakes. The meatloaf in particular is awesome, and that's a hard dish to make good. Great breakfast menu too. Scrambles and frittata are delicious. You are almost obligated (oh how unfortunate...) to have a cupcake after meals. To say they're the best cupcakes I've had would be an understatement. They also get creative points for themed cupcakes.

This review is based on my experience going to buy cupcakes and not having a meal here.  The woman behind the counter was cold....when you enter a place known for cupcakes, I feel like the staff should be smiling, helpful and appear to have a sugar rush at all times!  

I ordered 4 cupcakes:  triple chocolate, lemon blueberry, strawberry rhubarb and carrot cake.   The cupcakes were......meh.....and small.  For $12 the cupcakes should have been more substantial.  When I go somewhere to buy baked goods, I go because they are supposed to be better than what I make at home.  The only one that I would consider better than what I would make at home was the chocolate cupcake.  I have to say that I'm not impressed and I probably wouldn't be back.

I was first introduced years ago to Daisy when I received a package of their delicious cupcakes for my birthday. Fast forward a few years, and I finally had the opportunity to visit a few months back for brunch.

I love the small cafe feel of Daisy and it's a nice change of pace from some of the larger brunch spots in Madison. You instantly feel very welcome and at home in the bright and cheery decorated restaurant.  We were quickly seated inside, and I have to say the service was great. On this particular day, I was extremely under the weather and barely had a voice. But, our experience made up for it. 

I really wanted to try one of the signature egg casserole dishes, and ordered the Crimini Mushroom & Gruyere Strata. Unfortunately, after placing the order our waitress came back to let me know that they had just run out of that item for the day. No worries. I had heard the egg sandwich was great as well so placed an order for the Award-Winning Egg Sandwich. It comes with fried egg, bacon, cream cheese, purple onion and cilantro on grilled rosemary bread and is served with oven-roasted potatoes and fresh fruit. Basically it's delicious. 

I also of course had a bloody which was good and some coffee to wake me up a little. After devouring brunch, our waitress brought us our check and to our surprise had taken fifty percent off my my particular meal because my original order wasn't available. Completely unexpected but also very kind of her! It's those little things that make such a difference.

I couldn't leave Daisy without ordering a couple cupcakes to go. They were almost all gone as it was later in the morning. TIP - They can quickly sell out of cupcakes. If you're planning on birthday orders or any pick ups I would definitely call in advance and plan ahead.

This is definitely a place you should try out. Prices are great and the food and service fantastic.
Interesting first try of strata. Had a strong but good tasting. The scrambles also look very tasty, and they have huge burgers as well. Kids are all crazy for their cupcakes!

Stopped in for Restaurant Week, summer 2017, and was extremely pleased. What a cute little place! Portions were just the right size and the menu had great selections!

Had the Grapefruit, Avocado, Fennel & Feta salad for the appetizer. The dressing was an orange-shallot vinaigrette that was extremely refreshing and tasty! I ended up picking around the grapefruit, but if I had liked the fruit more it would have been the most perfect salad.

For the entree, I chose the Two Fish, Two Ways option. This was two pieces of fish -- one was salmon topped with pesto and the other was cod topped with fruit salsa. I originally thought I only had the option of one, so when I was told I'd be getting both, I was pleased! Since the plate included two pieces of fish, they were on the smaller size, but no complaints about that because I was full by the end of the meal! The entree was served with sautéed vegetables & mashed potatoes as well, which were both very good.

My friend had the steak with Daisy's house-made roasted-garlic chimichurri sauce & sharp white Cheddar for her entree. She ended up not being a fan of the sauce, but overall the steak was good-sized and cooked well.

For dessert, we decided to get and split the House-made Lemon-Blackberry Cheesecake and the House-made Sweet Cream Panna Cotta with Fresh Fruit Compote. Oh man, both were SO GOOD (and both were gluten-free so yay for those who need it that way!)!!! Panna cotta is like soft, creamy jello... might sound weird but it's delicious. And the cheesecake was flavorful and lemony with a tasty blackberry sauce to top it off.

I NEED to come here again (multiple times) so I can try their breakfast and lunch/dinner menus! Everything looks/sounds so good, and I can't wait to return :)

I really like the natural vibe of this place...and I like "real" food. I've stopped in quite a few times...usually to take something to go...the cupcakes are always a good treat, but today I tried a latte and a berry/cherry scone. The scone was a nice texture...light &  delicious, and the berries/cherries were fresh, and just the right sweet. I don't think I've had a better scone anywhere. The latte was really good, too. Nice people at the counter. Happiness.

Fully enjoyed my lunch there, had the egg sandwich with the oven roasted potatoes.  Putting cream cheese on the sandwich definitely put it over the top into greatness, and the roasted potatoes were excellent, soft and buttery.

Unfortunately the cupcakes left a lot to be desired.  I picked up half a dozen to bring home,  and we served them for dessert that night.  Not more than a few hours had passed, definitely not enough time for them to go stale, but when we tried to eat them, the cake part was incredibly dry, to the point of being unable to finish (and not finishing a cupcake is nearly unheard of for me).  On the vanilla cupcake I ordered for myself, I specifically asked if it was buttercream frosting, and was assured it was.  It was not.  Or if it was, it was the most flavorless buttercream I've ever had the displeasure of eating.  Since we had a red velvet left over as well, I abandoned my cupcake and tried red velvet instead.  The frosting was better, likely saved by the cream cheese, but the cupcake itself was again dry and tasteless.

All in all, I'd have lunch there again in a heartbeat, and even go out of my way to do so.  But I'll never get another cupcake from here.

I checked this place out by myself, and kind of got forgotten about.  There are few things as disheartening as grabbing lunch on your lonesome and being neglected by your server.  Service was kind of slow.  I dug the interior design, and sort of dug the food - which was fine, but nothing to write home about.  

I got a chocolate cupcake on my way out.  The cupcakes look better than they taste.  I like my chocolate cupcakes compact, with rich creamy frosting.  This was really oily, and the frosting was really heavy on the shortening and light on the chocolate-flavored goodness.  Not their fault, but a glob of frosting landed on my new shirt, which has retained an oil spot to this day.

What a bummer. The daisy cafe website says "vegan cupcakes offered daily." I made a special trip to their side of town for a cupcake and when I saw their cupcake case, nothing said vegan, so I asked the girl working if their were any vegan cupcakes. She just looked at me very confused and said no.

There are donut people and then there are cupcake people. Some may argue that they fall in between the two and like both, but these individuals are most certainly lying to themselves. 

I am 100% a donut person, BUT that is not to say I don't like cupcakes. I would preferrr donuts, but I'll consume sugar in all forms, yep - even cupcake form. 
Daisy Café and Cupcakery (as the name implies) is a cupcake person. She lives and sleeps and dreams all things cupcake, and it shows because she sure knows how to make em. 

Daisy cooks up a mean cinnamon cream cheese and carrot walnut cupcake with citrus notes that, in the words of Guy Fieri, makes this cupcake outta bounds.

I've also experienced the cream cheese red velvet and the chocolate peanut butter banana pecan, and while everything was mighty tasty, the true star of the show was the pecan pie cupcake that I was able to try. I follow Daisy on Facebook and they'll periodically post some of the rotating cupcake flavors and this pecan pie one made the page, and seeing as I am absolutely obsessed with pecan pie I knew I had to get my hands on this guy. And I did. And it.was.GOOD.

Cupcake/donut nonsense aside, Daisy also masters the art of good breakfast food. 

When I ate in here I stuck with the traditional "Pick 3" of 2 sunny up eggs, bacon, and a pancake. It did not disappoint. 

We also ordered the Chorizo and Avocado Omelet with housemade pico de gallo, oven roasted potatoes, and fresh fruit. Super yum. Great portions and so quality and fresh.

Daisy is a great find in terms of breakfast spots and delicious cupcakes. Highly recommend.

I had heard so much about Daisy Cafe and Cupcakery from other Yelp folks and magazines that I dragged a whole group of folks up here one Saturday morning. After the meal I wasn't sure what I did it for. 

The strata was billed as their speciality so decided to go for the chorizo and pepper jack one. What arrived was a quiche with the different ingredients built in layers to represent strata. I found it to be average. The chorizo was good but not at all spicy. The strata was good but not outstanding. 

My wife got the huevos rancheros which was again average. We have had better but this wasn't bad per se. 

Since it was a cupcakery we got a chocolate mocha and blueberry lemon cupcake. Both were again good but not great. 

We asked the server for a to go box which she forgot about and we went up to the counter to pick up. 

Good part is that they have parking for about 10-15 cars  

Overall it was an average experience. A bit of a let down given the great reviews. Definitely not something you drag a group of people to.

So good it's hard to save room for the cupcakes!

Daisy Cafe and Cupcakery has been a mainstay of my family's holiday dining out for a few years now. The large variety of menu options and always delicious dinners and cupcakes ensures everyone leaves satisfied.

From their pasta to salads to my new favorite stew in the Wisconsin winters, Daisy has it all. During our most recent visit I tried the pulled duck and sausage stew which hit the spot perfectly. The duck was tender and juicy, but still flavorful and the sausage added a good touch of spice and saltiness while the tomatoes held all of the flavor together.

Of course I finished with a cupcake which topped off the dinner. Service overall was attentive and helpful when we asked questions about items on the menu as well. I'm sure I'll be back again next time I'm in Madison.

YUMMY! YUMMY! YUMMY! Whenever I'm in the mood for fresh food, great service, and unbeatable prices (which is always) I head to the Daisy Cafe and Cupcakery. Their breakfast, lunch, and dinner menus feature a variety of food that are prepared with the utmost of care! I recommend this restaurant to everyone with taste buds and stomachs! 

Make sure to try the bacon chocolate cupcakes!

A go-to place for my husband and me for dinner, but bfast is also awesome.  The food is always fresh and delicious.  The cupcakes may seem small in our supersized world, but they are delicious, rich and just the right size to complement their tasty food.

My girlfriend and I stopped to get a cupcake, but decided to eat lunch while we were there. The food was great, I wasn't sure what to expect at first but it was all really fresh and delicious... On the other hand, the cupcakes were good, but not outstanding. We'll definitely be back for lunch again and we'll be trying breakfast here soon!
